intro: Diplazium conchatum, commonly known as the saddle-back fern, is a species of flowering plant in the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive fronds that have a saddle-shaped base, giving it its common name. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, including India, China, and Southeast Asia. Diplazium conchatum typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its leaves are leathery and have a rough texture, with spore-producing structures on the underside of the fronds.
